messages.content: How can I install the JPS Custom Nodes for ComfyUI?

To install the JPS Custom Nodes for ComfyUI, you can delete any previous versions, then navigate to the custom_nodes directory, clone the repository using `git clone https://github.com/JPS-GER/ComfyUI_JPS-Nodes.git`, and restart ComfyUI.
Can I use the JPS Custom Nodes in any ComfyUI workflow?
Yes, the nodes can be used in any ComfyUI workflow.
Are there alternative methods for installing the JPS Custom Nodes?
Yes, you can install the nodes using the ComfyUI Manager.
What types of nodes are included in the JPS Custom Nodes for ComfyUI?
The custom nodes include IO, Settings, Switches, Pipes, Math, Text, Image, and Style nodes.
What is the Lora Loader node used for?
The Lora Loader is used to load Lora models and has an on/off switch, which outputs 1 or 2, compatible with most 'x to 1' switches.
What does the SDXL Resolutions node offer?
The SDXL Resolutions node offers recommended SDXL resolutions and outputs height and width values.
What does the SDXL Basic Settings node do?
The SDXL Basic Settings node is a menu node for basic SDXL settings, required for most SDXL workflows, and includes FreeU options.
What does the SDXL Prompt Handling node do?
The SDXL Prompt Handling node allows you to control how text_g and text_l inputs will be handled, with various options and the ability to add an 'universal negative' prompt.
What is the SDXL Prompt Styler node used for?
The SDXL Prompt Styler adds artists, movies, and general styles to your text prompt, also offering the option to add an 'universal negative' prompt, and uses JSON files for customization.
What does the Image Switch node do?
The Image Switch is a '5 to 1' switch for images.
What is the ControlNet Switch node used for?
The ControlNet Switch is a '5 to 1' switch specifically for ControlNet.
What does the Get Image Size node do?
The Get Image Size node retrieves the width and height values from an input image, useful in combination with 'Resolution Multiply' and 'SDXL Recommended Resolution Calc' nodes.
